channel.title: How to make a website in HTML
channel.description:
I was not sure if this should go in web design or here, but as all people who visit web design already know how to code it HTML, I thought I would give it a go and post it here. Are you ready? Let's make a website in simple Steps!
[b]TUTORIAL HISTORY:[/b]
[ul][li]12/22/06 -Finished Base Tutorial[/li] [li]I MIGHT Soon Finish on how to make a more advanced site![/li][/ul]
[b]Index:[/b] -Chapter 1- Making A simple website.
[size=20pt]CHAPTER 1:[/size]
[b]Step 1: Host Your Sight![/b]
Register Here:
[url=http://signup.biz.ly/cgi-bin/path/signup?verify=1166844963]http://signup.biz.ly/cgi-bin/path/signup?verify=1166844963[/url]
^ If you need help with that ask :rolleyes:
[b]Step 2: Code Your Website![/b]
Ready to code your website? Let's go!
First we need to start off by opening notepad or MS word (or another program).
Click on the Start Menu>All Programs>*The Program You are using*
Now let's start coding! First we need to tell the computer it is in HTML. Type this:
[code] <HTML>
</HTML> [/code]
Leave a space in between the two so you can type stuff in the middle. The [code]/[/code] in front of the last [code]<HTML>[/code] tells the computer it is the end of that. A [code]/[/code] will be followed after every part of the code we want to end. Kind of like a [scar]end;[/scar] in SCAR. So what next? We must now give our website a name right?
[code] <HTML> <TITLE>Akriamisthebest</TITLE>
</HTML> [/code]
Type Whatever you want in between the [code]<TITLE> </TITLE>[/code]. Now save that as "Website.html" under "My Documents". Make sure you have the internet running, and go to "My Documents" and double click the file. A internet window should pop up displaying a blank page with the title you have selected. Now let's make it display some text!
[code] <HTML> <TITLE>Akriamisthebest</TITLE> <Body> This is my first Website! </Body> </HTML> [/code]
Again, type whatever you want between the [code]<Body></Body>[/code] you want. This is your very first website! I will update it later with how to add color's and other things! Now we need to host it :)
[b]STEP 3: GETTING YOUR SITE ON THE WEB![/b]
Remember the site you registered at? Go there again and log in! Once you are logged in click the button that looks like: [img]http://img132.imageshack.us/my.php?image=filemanagervw2.png[/img] (for the people with slow internet it is the 'file manager' button :))
After the page has loaded you will see a list of files. Click the edit button next to Index.html. After that page has loaded there will be a bunch of coding similar to the stuff you just did. GET RID OF IT ALL! Then copy and paste the code we just made into the text box. "Click Save File". And WALA! You are done!
Remember look for updates in the future, and for a complete list of HTML tags, look here:
[url=http://www.web-source.net/html_codes_chart.htm]http://www.web-source.net/html_codes_chart.htm[/url]
EDIT: Sorry for the weird spacing with the [code] tags, it just ended up that way :)[/code]

item.description:
@Akriam wrote:

I was not sure if this should go in web design or here, but as all people who visit web design already know how to code it HTML, I thought I would give it a go and post it here. Are you ready? Let’s make a website in simple Steps!

TUTORIAL HISTORY:

[li]I MIGHT Soon Finish on how to make a more advanced site![/li][/ul]

Index:
-Chapter 1- Making A simple website.

[size=20pt]CHAPTER 1:[/size]

Step 1: Host Your Sight!

Register Here:

http://signup.biz.ly/cgi-bin/path/signup?verify=1166844963

^
If you need help with that ask :rolleyes:

Step 2: Code Your Website!

Ready to code your website? Let’s go!

First we need to start off by opening notepad or MS word (or another program).

Click on the Start Menu>All Programs>The Program You are using

Now let’s start coding! First we need to tell the computer it is in HTML. Type this:

<HTML>


</HTML>

Leave a space in between the two so you can type stuff in the middle. The / in front of the last <HTML> tells the computer it is the end of that. A / will be followed after every part of the code we want to end. Kind of like a [scar]end;[/scar] in SCAR. So what next? We must now give our website a name right?

<HTML>
<TITLE>Akriamisthebest</TITLE>

</HTML>

Type Whatever you want in between the <TITLE> </TITLE>. Now save that as “Website.html” under “My Documents”. Make sure you have the internet running, and go to “My Documents” and double click the file. A internet window should pop up displaying a blank page with the title you have selected. Now let’s make it display some text!

<HTML>
<TITLE>Akriamisthebest</TITLE>
<Body>
This is my first Website!
</Body>
</HTML>

Again, type whatever you want between the <Body></Body> you want. This is your very first website! I will update it later with how to add color’s and other things! Now we need to host it

STEP 3: GETTING YOUR SITE ON THE WEB!

Remember the site you registered at? Go there again and log in! Once you are logged in click the button that looks like:

(for the people with slow internet it is the ‘file manager’ button :))

After the page has loaded you will see a list of files. Click the edit button next to Index.html. After that page has loaded there will be a bunch of coding similar to the stuff you just did. GET RID OF IT ALL! Then copy and paste the code we just made into the text box. “Click Save File”. And WALA! You are done!

Remember look for updates in the future, and for a complete list of HTML tags, look here:

http://www.web-source.net/html_codes_chart.htm

EDIT: Sorry for the weird spacing with the tags, it just ended up that way :)
